content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="/xsl/oairepository/oai2.xsl.v1.0" ?> <OAI-PMH xmlns="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/OAI-PMH.xsd"> <responseDate>2014-10-30T01:04:52Z</responseDate><request verb="ListRecords" set="user-coar" metadataPrefix="oai_dc">http://zenodo.org/oai2d</request><ListRecords> <record><header><identifier>oai:zenodo.org:12384</identifier><datestamp>2014-10-27T18:16:38Z</datestamp><setSpec>user-coar</setSpec><setSpec>user-zenodo</setSpec><setSpec>openaire</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd"> <dc:creator>McCutcheon, Valerie</dc:creator> <dc:creator>Nixon, William</dc:creator> <dc:title>Repository Profile: University of Glasgow: "Enlighten" IR & Research System. COAR Repository Observatory</dc:title> <dc:date>2014-10-16</dc:date> <dc:subject>cc-by</dc:subject> <dc:identifier>http://zenodo.org/record/12384</dc:identifier> <dc:identifier> doi:10.5281/zenodo.12384</dc:identifier> <dc:description><p>The University of Glasgow has established the &ldquo;Enlighten&rdquo; IR and Research system. The IR holds 72,000 items for institutional peer-reviewed journal articles, published conference papers, books and book chapters.</p> <p>The Research System is an in-house-built system holding research information for institutional research activity, including people, organisations, projects and outputs. It is dynamically linked to the Enlighten IR.</p></dc:description> <dc:rights> info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess </dc:rights> <dc:type> info:eu-repo/semantics/article </dc:type> </oai_dc:dc> </metadata></record><record><header><identifier>oai:zenodo.org:12475</identifier><datestamp>2014-10-29T15:19:00Z</datestamp><setSpec>openaire</setSpec><setSpec>user-coar</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd"> <dc:creator>Ribeiro, L gia Maria</dc:creator> <dc:title>Repository Profile: Repository and CRIS at the University of Porto. COAR Repository Observatory</dc:title> <dc:date>2014-10-16</dc:date> <dc:subject>cc-by</dc:subject> <dc:identifier>http://zenodo.org/record/12475</dc:identifier> <dc:identifier> doi:10.5281/zenodo.12475</dc:identifier> <dc:description><p>At the University of Porto (U.Porto) both repository and CRIS are being used as part of the local e-infrastructure. U.Porto Open Repository is the largest institutional repository on RCAAP, the Portuguese Open Access Scientific Repository, hosting 32.616 full text CC-BY works as of September 2014.</p> <p>SIGARRA-CRIS and U.Porto Open Repository are interoperable. When on the SIGARRA-CRIS the full text of a publication is registered and available on a CC BY basis both the corresponding metadata and the digital object are automatically transferred to the U.Porto Open Repository.</p></dc:description> <dc:rights> info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess </dc:rights> <dc:type> info:eu-repo/semantics/article </dc:type> </oai_dc:dc> </metadata></record><record><header><identifier>oai:zenodo.org:12477</identifier><datestamp>2014-10-29T15:19:00Z</datestamp><setSpec>openaire</setSpec><setSpec>user-coar</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd"> <dc:creator>Moreira, Jo o</dc:creator> <dc:title>Repository Profile: RCAAP & PTCRIS. COAR Repository Observatory</dc:title> <dc:date>2014-10-16</dc:date> <dc:subject>cc-by</dc:subject> <dc:identifier>http://zenodo.org/record/12477</dc:identifier> <dc:identifier> doi:10.5281/zenodo.12477</dc:identifier> <dc:description><p>RCAAP (Reposit&oacute;rio Cientifico de Acesso Aberto de Portugal) is the main instrument for open access development in Portugal. It is a national open access initiative with 42 Institutional Repositories, one shared repository with 30 institutions, 30 Scientific journals and ore than 185.000 OA docs.</p> <p>PTCRIS is a program that aims to ensure the creation and sustained development of a national integrated information ecosystem (PTCRIS) to support research management.</p></dc:description> <dc:rights> info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess </dc:rights> <dc:type> info:eu-repo/semantics/article </dc:type> </oai_dc:dc> </metadata></record></ListRecords> </OAI-PMH>
